actions.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 643.

official_title: A bill to prohibit funding of the negotiation of the move of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States until the Secretary of State has required the divestiture of property purchased by the Xinhua News Agency in violation of the Foreign Missions Act.
short_title: Chinese News Agency Divestiture Act of 2000

summary.text: Chinese News Agency Divestiture Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of State to report to specified congressional committees on whether the Secretary intends to require the People's Republic of China divest itself of the property purchased at 1515 Arlington Ridge Road by the Xinhua News Agency.Prohibits the obligation of funds made available to the Department of State for Administration of Foreign Affairs to negotiate the purchase of property by China to relocate its embassy in the United States until the Secretary has made a certain certification to specified congressional committees with respect to divestiture of such property and certain mandatory procedures under the Foreign Missions Act for future property purchases by China in the United States.

titles.title: Chinese News Agency Divestiture Act of 2000

A bill to prohibit funding of the negotiation of the move of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States until the Secretary of State has required the divestiture of property purchased by the Xinhua News Agency in violation of the Foreign Missions Act.
